questions.question: What is the yield percentage of Zn-PDI when used for the photo-reduction of 4’-bromoacetophenone under optimal conditions?
How does the yield of the photo-reduction of 4’-bromoacetophenone change when Zn-PDI is replaced with H2PDI?
Is the performance of Zn-PDI in the photo-oxidation of benzyl alcohol comparable to the porphyrin-based PCN-22 system?
questions.answer: Yes, the performance of Zn-PDI is comparable to the porphyrin-based PCN-22 system.

questions.question: What is the turnover number (TON) of Zn-PDI in the photooxidation of benzyl alcohol under the specified conditions?
Does the addition of DABCO or benzoquinone significantly affect the photo-oxidation yield of benzylamine when using Zn-PDI as the catalyst?
questions.answer: The addition of DABCO significantly decreases the yield, while benzoquinone slightly decreases it.

questions.question: Can Zn-PDI be reused without significant loss in activity for the photo-oxidation of benzyl alcohol?
questions.answer: Yes, Zn-PDI can be reused up to three times without significant loss in activity.

questions.question: What is the effect of using a dark environment or nitrogen atmosphere on the photo-oxidation of benzylamine with Zn-PDI?
questions.answer: Both a dark environment and nitrogen atmosphere significantly reduce the yield of the photo-oxidation of benzylamine.

questions.question: What is the yield of the photo-oxidation of benzylamine to its corresponding imine using Zn-PDI as the catalyst?
Is the photoactivity of Zn-PDI for the oxidation of benzyl alcohols and amines influenced by the synergistic interaction between PDI stacks and Zn nodes?
questions.answer: True, the photoactivity of Zn-PDI for the oxidation of benzyl alcohols and amines is influenced by the synergistic interaction between PDI stacks and Zn nodes.

questions.question: What role does the distorted tetrahedron geometry of Zn in Zn-PDI play in its catalytic activity?
questions.answer: The distorted tetrahedron geometry of Zn in Zn-PDI, similar to the active Zn site in LADH, may coordinate to and activate the substrate molecules, enhancing its catalytic activity.
